intro: Ranunculus apioides, commonly known as the meadow buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers with a central pistil surrounded by stamens. Its leaves are deeply lobed and arranged alternately along the stem. Ranunculus apioides thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
